meanings.definition: A piece of bread or similar food dipped in liquid.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the tasty sop in her soup.
meanings.sent2: He dipped the sop in the flavorful broth.
meanings.sent3: The sop in the stew made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The sop soaked up the delicious flavors like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The warm sop melted in her mouth, comforting her.

meanings.definition: Something given to pacify or soothe.
meanings.sent1: The toy was a sop to calm the crying child.
meanings.sent2: He offered her a sop to ease her worries.
meanings.sent3: The sop of candy made him forget his troubles.
meanings.sent4: Kind words can be a sop for a troubled heart.
meanings.sent5: The sop of music lulled her into peaceful sleep.

meanings.definition: To soak up liquid by absorption.
meanings.sent1: The sponge will sop up the spilled milk.
meanings.sent2: She used a cloth to sop up the water from the floor.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty plant seemed to sop up the rain eagerly.
meanings.sent4: The paper towel quickly sopped up the spilled juice.
meanings.sent5: The dry towel was able to sop up the excess water.

meanings.sent1: He tried to sop up her anger with an apology.
meanings.sent2: The delicious meal sopped up his hunger.
meanings.sent3: She hoped the gift would sop up his disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project sopped up their doubts.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture sopped up her worries like a sponge.
